document_title: Testicular cancer: Signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Testicular cancer is a condition in which normal cells in the testicles change and grow out of control, leading to the formation of tumors. Testicles are part of the male reproductive system, located below the penis and in the scrotum.
Testicular cancer is often divided into 3 stages:
Stage I: Tumor localized in the testicles.; Stage II: Cancer cells have spread to lymph nodes in the lower abdomen; Stage III: Cancer has spread to other areas of the body.
subsection_title: ung thu tinh hoan.json. What is testicular cancer?
